title: Winamp Music Player Audio Upgrade
description: Comprehensive audio system upgrade for faux-Winamp MIDI player: fixed volume control, real FFT visualizer, 3-band EQ with Windows 3.1 styling, and professional audio chain with dynamics compression.

skills.name: sound-engineer
skills.contribution: Designed and implemented complete Web Audio API signal chain: GainNode volume control with logarithmic scaling, 3-band parametric EQ (lowshelf/peaking/highshelf), DynamicsCompressor for clipping prevention, AnalyserNode for FFT visualization. Created useFFTData and useVUMeter hooks for real-time audio analysis.

skills.name: windows-3-1-web-designer
skills.contribution: Designed EQ panel with authentic Windows 3.1 aesthetics: outset borders, blue gradient title bar, inset value displays, proper MS Sans Serif typography. Classic button states (hover, active) with period-accurate styling.

skills.name: web-design-expert
skills.contribution: Integrated new audio features into existing component architecture. Ensured responsive design for EQ panel on mobile. Maintained vaporwave aesthetic while adding new controls.

phases.name: Phase 1: Core Audio Infrastructure
phases.description: Created proper Web Audio API signal chain with GainNode, EQ filters, compressor, and analyser. Fixed broken volume control.

phases.name: Phase 2: Real-Time Visualization
phases.description: Implemented useFFTData hook for real frequency analysis. Updated WinampModal and MinifiedMusicPlayer visualizers to use actual FFT data instead of CSS animations.

phases.name: Phase 3: EQ User Interface
phases.description: Designed and implemented 3-band EQ panel with Windows 3.1 styling. Vertical sliders with dB readouts, reset functionality, and real-time audio response.

issues: Volume control non-functional (AudioDestinationNode has no gain property)
FFT visualizer was fake CSS animations, not responsive to audio
No audio processing chain (no EQ, compression, or analysis)
Poor audio quality without dynamics processing

improvements: Fully functional volume control with logarithmic scaling
Real FFT visualizer responding to actual audio frequencies
Complete audio chain: Gain → EQ → Compressor → Analyser → Output
3-band parametric EQ (Bass, Mid, Treble) with ±12dB range
Smooth decay animations when audio stops

learnings: AudioDestinationNode doesn't have a gain property - must create a GainNode
Human hearing is logarithmic, so volume should use Math.pow(volume, 2) scaling
setTargetAtTime is essential for smooth audio parameter changes (prevents clicks)
DynamicsCompressor threshold around -24dB with 12:1 ratio works well for music
AnalyserNode fftSize of 64 gives 32 bins, good for 24-bar visualizer
requestAnimationFrame loops need cleanup in useEffect return to prevent memory leaks
